This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=FEDORAEU.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-02T14:33:33Z Chris L Awre 2015-03-02T14:33:02+00:00 2015-03-02T14:33:02+00:00 Hydra Europe digital repository events Spring 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEDORAEU;d19a3599.1503 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEDORAEU;d19a3599.1503">Hydra Europe digital repository events Spring 2015 </a> Islandora Community 2015-02-23T13:28:41-04:00 2015-02-23T13:28:41-04:00 [EVENT] Islandora Camp in Madrid, May 27 - 29. Early Bird discount extended! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEDORAEU;12390995.1502 To give our attendees an extra chance at savings a few euros, the Early<br>Bird discount for Islandora Camp in Madrid has been extended until the end<br>of February. This three day learning-and-teaching event is taking place<br>from May 27 - 29 in Madrid, Spain, and is sponsored in part by Fundaci\ufffd\ufffdn<br>Juan March. A call for proposals is open until March 1st. [...] Islandora Community 2015-01-30T12:07:20-04:00 2015-01-30T12:07:20-04:00 EVENT: Islandora Camp EU2 - Madrid May 27 - 29 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEDORAEU;d16f568e.1501 With apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>The Islandora Foundation is pleased to invite you to our European Islandora<br>Camp for 2015: Islandora Camp EU2, taking place from May 27 - 29 in Madrid,<br>Spain and sponsored by Fundaci\ufffd\ufffdn Juan March. Early Bird registration is<br>open until February 15th and a Call for Proposals is open until March 1st. [...] K\ufffd\ufffdre Fiedler Christiansen 2014-10-03T07:36:45+02:00 2014-10-03T07:36:45+02:00 Discontinuing Fedora EU mailing list https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEDORAEU;2ba94fbc.1410 Dear all,<br><br>The Fedora EU mailing list has seen very limited traffic, and most has been cross posted to the regular mailing lists.<br><br>On the Fedora User Group meeting in Karlsruhe, Matthias Razum and I talked about discontinuing the list, and using the general Fedora mailing lists for the very limited amount of European only Fedora content.
